bibl.title: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, November 12, 1923

div1.p: Williamson informs Carter that the Rockefeller Foundation plans to issue a pamphlet about the use of fish in both yellow fever and malaria control. He would like Carter to read the galley proof.

div1.head: Letter from C.C. Williamson to Henry Rose Carter, November 12, 1923
div1.opener:
GEORGE E. VINCENT, PRESIDENT
EDWIN R. EMBREE, SECRETARY
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
L. G. MYERS, TREASURER
ROBERT H. KIRK, COMPTROLLER
I. H. B.
Fish!
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “ROCKFOUND”
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
F. F. RUSSELL, M. D., GENERAL DIRECTOR
CHINA MEDICAL BOARD
ROGER F. GREENT, DIRECTOR
DIVISION OF MEDICAL EDUCATION
RICHARD M. PEARCE, M.D., DIRECTOR
INFORMATION SERVICE
C. C. WILLIAMSON, Chief
November 12, 1923
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
On account of the widespread interest in the use of fish in both
yellow fever and malaria control, the Information Service of the Rockefeller
Foundation has been called upon to prepare a summary of the available liter-
ature on the subject. It is now proposed to issue this digest in pamphlet
form.

In order to make the compilation as complete and accurate as possible
it has occurred to us to submit it in advance of publication in the form of
galley proof to a few people known to be especially interested, asking them
to look it over and let us have the benefit of any criticisms or suggestions
they are willing to make. Should you have time to look over the uncorrected
proof which is being sent to you in separate cover, we shall be grateful if
you will call our attention to points not adequately covered, possible errors
of statement, and anything else that seems to you to need further attention
to make the pamphlet of the greatest value to those interested in mosquito
control work.

The full list of literature to which references are made in the
text has not been set up yet, but will appear in the final printing.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, C. C. Williamson Dr. H. R. Carter
United States Public Health Service
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
